wikipedia_page.main: Eve Balfour (3 May 1890 – 19 March 1955) was a New Zealand-born British stage and film actress.

response: Eve Balfour may refer to:
* Lady Eve Balfour (1899–1990), English farmer, educator and organic farming pioneer
* Eve Balfour (actress) (1890–1955), British stage and film actress

* Eve Balfour as The Woman in Black

The Woman Who Did is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by Walter West and starring Eve Balfour, Thomas H. MacDonald and George Foley.BFI.org It was adapted from the 1895 novel The Woman Who Did by Grant Allen. It follows the life of Herminia Barton, a Cambridge-educated woman as she tries to make it in the world by herself.
* Eve Balfour

Burnt Wings is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by Walter West and starring Eve Balfour, Joseph Tozer and Thomas H. MacDonald. It was adapted from the 1909 novel Burnt Wings by Mrs Stanley Wrench. A woman decides to bring up a baby that her husband has had with his mistress.Low p.191
* Eve Balfour - Margaret Dennis
|The Scarlet Wooing||Sidney Morgan||Eve Balfour, George Keene||Drama||
|The Woman of the Iron Bracelets||Sidney Morgan||Eve Balfour, George Keene||Crime||

The Scarlet Wooing is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by Sidney Morgan and starring Eve Balfour, George Keene and Marguerite Blanche. The screenplay concerns an author who writes a scandalous novel in order to raise funds for his daughter's operation.
*    Eve Balfour as Mrs. Raeburn

link_mentions.page: The Woman of the Iron Bracelets
response: The Woman of the Iron Bracelets is a 1920 British silent crime film directed by Sidney Morgan and starring Eve Balfour, George Keene and Marguerite Blanche.
* Eve Balfour as Noah Berwell
The Black Sheep is a 1920 British silent romance film directed by Sidney Morgan and starring Marguerite Blanche, George Keene, Eve Balfour, and Arthur Lennard.
* Eve Balfour as Laurie Fenton

Jack Tar is a 1915 British silent war film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Jack Tessier, Eve Balfour and Thomas H. MacDonald.Goble p.273 An Admiral's daughter goes undercover in Turkey to help a British agent thwart a German plot during the First World War.
* Eve Balfour as Margherita

Five Nights is a 1915 British silent romance film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Eve Balfour, Thomas H. MacDonald and Sybil de Bray.Low p.128-29 It was based on a novel of the same title by Victoria Cross.
*   Eve Balfour as Viola

Cynthia in the Wilderness is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by Harold Weston and starring Eve Balfour, Ben Webster and Milton Rosmer. It was based on a novel of the same name by Hubert Wales.Low p.192
* Eve Balfour as Cynthia Elwes
* Eve Balfour (c. 1919)."Miss Eve Balfour, British Venus, Who Will Quit London For America". The Evening World (New York). 10 December 1919. p. 3.
